overview:
Set Delimiter tags are used to change the tag delimiters for all content
following the tag in the current compilation unit.

The tag's content MUST be any two non-whitespace sequences (separated by
whitespace) EXCEPT an equals sign ('=') followed by the current closing
delimiter.

Set Delimiter tags SHOULD be treated as standalone when appropriate.

tests.name: Pair Behavior
tests.desc: The equals sign (used on both sides) should permit delimiter changes.

tests.name: Special Characters
tests.desc: Characters with special meaning regexen should be valid delimiters.

tests.name: Sections
tests.desc: Delimiters set outside sections should persist.

tests.name: Inverted Sections
tests.desc: Delimiters set outside inverted sections should persist.

tests.name: Partial Inheritence
tests.desc: Delimiters set in a parent template should not affect a partial.

tests.name: Post-Partial Behavior
tests.desc: Delimiters set in a partial should not affect the parent template.

tests.name: Surrounding Whitespace
tests.desc: Surrounding whitespace should be left untouched.

tests.name: Standalone Tag
tests.desc: Standalone lines should be removed from the template.

tests.name: Indented Standalone Tag
tests.desc: Indented standalone lines should be removed from the template.

tests.name: Standalone Line Endings
tests.desc: "\r\n" should be considered a newline for standalone tags.

tests.name: Standalone Without Previous Line
tests.desc: Standalone tags should not require a newline to precede them.

tests.name: Standalone Without Newline
tests.desc: Standalone tags should not require a newline to follow them.

tests.name: Pair with Padding
tests.desc: Superfluous in-tag whitespace should be ignored.
